Mental representations connect internal with external state

Last updated on April 28, 2021

The representatum of a mental representation consists of the physical state, the underlying neural substrate. The representandum of a mental representation consists of an aspect of the world. In this, mental representations link transient neural activity with meaningful entities, they are tools and instruments interfacing us with information, especially in idealism. Representations of the actual concrete “now” are simply presentations.

Resources

  • https://mitpress.mit.edu/books/being-no-one
